result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion. This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes in 15CF!74, 15CF143 and 15CF105.

defendant stopped in and said he can't make 10/19/15 hearing he has another commitment; told him to contact his attorney and since he already contacted SPDO to do so again and see who his atty is

This bond includes cases: 15CF174; 15CF143; 15CM154; and 15CF105:  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: M. Defendant understood.  Defendant has not contacted counsel yet.  Court advised him to do so, either SPD or Attorney Ritland.  Bond set.  AIA set for 10/19/15 at 9:30 am.

Covers Case No. 15CF105 and 15CM154.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed. DA Gerald Fox is requesting bond modification.  Attorney Ritland argues against.  State called Deputy A.O., sworn by court.  Witness identified the defendant.  State questioned witness regarding an incident that occured in Trempealeau County.  Witness was offering mutual aide in the incident.  Attorney Ritland questioned witness.  Court took judicial notice of defendant's current bonds.
Hearing at 09-11-2015 09:30 am
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Ritland appeared in court.  No agreement.   Track with preliminary hearing in 15CF105.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Reading of complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court.  PTC & STC set.  Bond continued.  Court advised defendant to report for booking.
